msContents.summary: The recto deals with payments of money for the months Choiah, Tybi, Mecheir and Phamenoth of an unknown year in the first century A.D. It is not clear why these payments were made. Most amounts. though not all of them, can be divided by four. On the verso we find one column containing a list of names of foreigners who make payments for an unknown tax(?). In addition there is a list of expenses spread over three columns ( = Ib - d) and headed (line 106): "logos gerdion dia Kotouitos". A second column contains a date and a payment by one more foreigner.

msItemStruct.note: Location: Department of Special Collections; Memorial Library; Madison; Wisconsin

condition.ab: A light-brown papyrus, regularly cut off at all sides. At 13,5 cm from the left-hand side there is a kollema. Eleven vertical folds are still visible. Below to the left a piece of papyrus is missing. The papyrus is damaged by abrasion and a great many holes (especially along the folds).

layout.ab: recto: col. I, 1-42; col. II, 43-74, col. III, 75-91;verso: col. I, 92-145; col. II, 146-147

handDesc.p: Recto: On the left there is a margin of 3 to 2 cm, at the top one of 2,5 to 1,5 cm. There is a free space of 7,5 cm between columns I and II and one of 3 cm. between columns II and III. Below column II there is a free space of approx. 3 cm and below column III one of approx. 8 cm.;On palaeographical grounds the papyrus should be dated to the first century A.D.;Verso: Column Ia starts 14 cm from the left-hand side; below there is a free space of approx. 2 cm. Column Ib starts 10 cm from the left. Column Ic starts 16,5 cm from the left. The space between columns Ib and Ic ranges from 0 up to 2 cm. Column Id starts 22,5 cm from the right-hand side. Column II starts 18 cm from the right-hand side. Between columns I and II 2 cm have been left free

origin.origPlace: A village in the Polemon meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt (see ed. princ. note on l. 92-105)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: As designation of the place of origin of some persons:;Kerkesoucha;;Dionysias, Themistou meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt;;Nesos; Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt;;Neilopolis; Herakleides meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt;;Taurinos; Themistou meris, Arsinoite nome, Egypt;;Bakchias;

Total 2[ ]8 dr. From these in the bank in the month Neronios Augustus 1040 dr. Similarly, other 500 dr; in Tybi similarly 68 dr; similarly other [ ] dr to the hegoumenos; similarly other [ ] dr; similarly in the 30th other 400 dr. remainder other 100 dr. from the which the expenses.;Another account daily through Petheus, son of Harapaesis, hegoumenos.;Tybi 19 - 28 dr; 20 - 8 dr; 21 - 48 dr; 22 - 8 dr; 23 - 32 dr; 26 - 14 dr 2 ob; 27 - 160 dr; 28 - 400 dr.; 29 - 809 dr 4 ob; 30 - 426 dr; total for the month 1938 dr; Mecheir 1; 1- 167 dr; 2 - 48 dr; 3 - 6 dr 2 ob; 6 - 234 dr 3 ob; 7 - 153 dr - i ob; 8 - 76 dr; 9 - 38 dr 4 ob; 10 - 110 dr; 11 - 58 dr 4 ob; 12 - 24 dr; 24 - 8 dr; total for the month 978 dr.;total 2916 dr of silver dr.;From these in the bank in Tybi similarly 1140 dr. similarly other 880 dr; similarly other 60 dr; similarly other 500 dr; similarly other 40 dr similarly other 72 dr through Harapaesis, son of Pethes. Of these in the bank 5212 dr.;Similarly and through Kotouis, another hegoumenos;Mecheir 25 - 20 dr; 26 - 89 dr 4 1/2 ob; 27 - 240 dr 12 ob; 28 - 108 dr; 29 - 52 dr; 30 - 8 dr; total for the month 519 dr 2 1/2 ob; ;Phamenoth 1 - 24 dr.; 2 - 121 dr 2 ob; 3 - 43 dr; 4 - 130 dr; 5 - 40 dr; total for the month 877 dr 4 1/2 ob; from these in the banl 400 dr. sililarly in the 5 (of the month) other 360 dr . remainder 17 dr 4 1/2/ ob.;Account of thetax paid by the foreigners;Phamenoth 1 ;Harpaesis, from Kerkesoucha 3 dr 3 ob;;Onnophris from Dionysias 3 dr 3 ob;;Onnophris, son of Sambas 4 dr;;Horis, son of Hermas for his son 1 dr 5 ob;;Pases from Nesos 20 ob;Kames for Neilou polis through Petr( ) 4 dr;;Pasion son of Ammonios 4 dr;;Nekpheraus from Bakchias 4 dr;;heron from Taurinos 4 dr;;Epaphras 4 dr.;Ptollion son of Petees 2 dr;;Sokmenis son of Pakysis 4 dr;;Horos son of Satabous from Nesos 8 dr;Account of the weavers through Kotouis;Mecheir 10;account of weavers 28 dr;;[fragmnetary status of about 17 lines];Phamenoth 2;---;weavers;for cutting fowl 3 ob;3 (of the month) similarly another 3 ob;;vegetables dr;;vinegar ob;cheiristikon 1 dr 4 ob;;exchange of 2 stateres 2 ob;;To Heron the mach(etes?) 4 dr;;To Ptolemaios --- for writing the document 8 dr;;--- 5 dr 3 ob;;To Panephremmis the komarch 9 dr;;---;to Hydrophylax 4 dr;to the builder breaking --- 1 dr;;to Papepn( ) the parachytes 1 dr;;to the machaerophoros of the strategos --- 2 1/2/;Expenses for 8 days 4 dr 4 ob;;Pharmouthi 10;Kames from Neilopolis 4 dr
